page.title: 13CHURCH LIFE IN TEALING
page.content: THERE HAS BEEN A CHURCH AT KIRKTON OF TEALING (JUST OUTSIDE OUR SURVEY AREA) SINCE AT LEAST THE DAYS OF ST. CURITAN IN THE 8th.CENTURY.THE CHURCH WAS DEDICATED TO ST. PETER.THE PRESENT BUILDING DATES FROM c1810 AND IS PROBABLY THE FOURTH CHURCH ON THE SAME SITE.AT THE MOMENT IT IS NOT IN USE FOR WORSHIP BUT IT IS HOPED THAT IT WILL BE REOPENED OS A KIRK HERITAGE CENTRE SHOWING PEOPLE WHAT A RURAL CHURCH IN SCOTLAND WAS LIKE THROUGH THE CENTURIES. FROM 1843 TO 1929 THERE WAS A FREE CHURCH IN TEALING AS WELL AS THE PARISH ONE.THIS BUILDING IS ON HUNTINGFAULDS ROAD,BESIDE MANSEFIELD (THE FREE CHURCH MANSE).FURTHER DOWN THE ROAD THERE WAS A FREE CHURCH SCHOOL AND SCHOOLHOUSE.THE HOUSE IS STILL OCCUPIED TODAY.
